title: Convergence of European Higher Education Systems and Strategies for Implementing Student-Centered Learning (SCL)

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Designing math education courses for practitioners by applying European higher education standardization and student-centered learning approaches to enhance educational effectiveness

learning_goals: Learners can analyze key characteristics of the European higher education system (credit system, degree structure, etc.) and comparatively explain them through mathematical modeling.
Learners strengthen practitioner collaboration competencies by applying student-centered learning (SCL) principles to project-based mathematical problem-solving.

Learners create activity templates using at least three digital tools (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet, Mentimeter) to design smartphone-based PBL (problem-based learning) activities, execute a 2-week PBL scenario for real workplace problem-solving, and submit process-based deliverables (problem definition, interim report, final output).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
